title: How should רָגַז be translated in Psalm 4? - Quora

response.answer_text: It can mean “be angry,” “tremble,” “be agitated,” or “to be excited.” Generally the word describes being so emotional that you are shaking with fear, rage, or excitement. The Septuagint took it to mean “be angry,” but you could take the verse broadly as “feel your emotions but don’t let them cause you to sin.”
